data.tag: What is GitHub and how does it work
patterns: What is GitHub
How does GitHub work
How can you use GitHub
Can you share code on Github
Can you contribute to open source projects on GitHub
Can you automate your work with GitHub
Is GitHub good for collaboration
Does GitHub have version control
responses: GitHub is the home for all developers—a platform where you can share code, contribute to open source projects, or even automate your workflow with tools like GitHub Actions and Packages. If you’re just getting started with GitHub, you may know us best as a place for version control and collaboration.

data.tag: How do I see GitHub’s availability
patterns: How do I see GitHub’s availability
Is GitHub available
Does GitHub have a real time status report
Are Github's systems operational
Are there any GitHub services that are currently down
What GitHub services are working
responses:
Check our real-time status report
https://www.githubstatus.com/

patterns: Why is GitHub so popular
What are some of GitHub's achievements and milestones
Is Github a large open source community
responses:
GitHub is built by developers for developers, and we’re proud to be home to the world’s largest open source community. With 50 million developers and millions more open source projects, GitHub has become the go-to place to collaborate and build software together.
https://github.com/about/milestones

patterns: Who is GitHub for
Can I use GitHub for personal projects
Who uses GitHub
Can I use GitHub for a small group project
Can a college professor use GitHub for a class
Is GitHub helpful for project managers
Is GitHub worth using in a large company
responses:
It’s not just developers who build on GitHub—Fortune 500 companies, small teams, project managers, and college professors all use GitHub to do their best work, in one place.
https://github.com/readme

data.tag: Do people use GitHub only for code
patterns: Do people use GitHub only for code
Can GitHub manage teams
Can you share resumes with GitHub
Can you track projects with GitHub
Can you have online discussions with GitHub
responses:
Different people and teams use GitHub for different projects. While we got our start as a version control platform, GitHub is now used to manage teams, share resumes, find new projects, track work, and host discussions, just to name a few.
https://github.com/explore

patterns: Why should I use GitHub
Does GitHub shape the future of software and coding
Can using GitHub help grow my skills
responses:
GitHub isn’t just a place to share code. It’s a chance to do something bigger. On GitHub, you can shape the future of software, work with the best developers in the world, and grow your skills and help others.
https://octoverse.github.com/

data.tag: Are Git and GitHub the same
patterns: Are Git and GitHub the same
What is a Git repository
What is a version control system
Is there a manual for GitHub
Is there a handbook for GitHub
responses:
Git is a version control system (VCS). GitHub is the platform where Git repositories can be hosted and teams can work on them together.
https://guides.github.com/introduction/git-handbook/

data.tag: Do I need Git in order to use GitHub
patterns: Do I need Git in order to use GitHub
Can I use GitHub with a Subversion client
Can I use GitHub with another client besides Git
responses:
GitHub repositories can be accessed from both Git and Subversion (SVN) clients.
https://docs.github.com/en/github/importing-your-projects-to-github/support-for-subversion-clients

patterns: Is GitHub safe
What security does GitHub have
Does GitHub offer code security
responses:
Millions of teams trust GitHub to keep their work safe. While security incidents can happen, our GitHub Security Team goes beyond industry standards to keep you and your code secure.
https://github.com/security

patterns: Is GitHub free
Are public and private repositories free
What is GitHub Pro
What is GitHub Team
What is GitHub Enterprise
Is there a Github membership
Are there any paid or premium plans for GitHub
Does GitHub have extra features
responses:
All GitHub users and teams get free, unlimited access to public and private repositories. But if you’re looking for more collaboration features, security controls, and deployment options, we also offer paid plans: GitHub Pro, GitHub Team at $4 per user/month, and GitHub Enterprise at $21 per user/month.
https://github.com/pricing

patterns: Is GitHub owned by Microsoft
Who owns GitHub
Who runs GitHub
responses:
Microsoft acquired GitHub in 2018. You can read more about it in our announcement here.
https://github.blog/2018-10-26-github-and-microsoft/

data.tag: How do I start using GitHub
patterns: How do I start using GitHub
How do I set up a GitHub account
Is there an activation guide
responses:
All you need is a GitHub account and internet access.
https://guides.github.com/activities/hello-world/
